meanings.sent1: The soup was saltier than the crackers.
meanings.sent2: The ocean water is saltier than the river water.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally made the cake saltier than the sea.
meanings.sent4: Her tears tasted saltier than the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The air near the beach felt saltier than usual.

meanings.definition: Resembling salt in taste or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The white crystals looked saltier than sugar.
meanings.sent2: The rock formations in the desert were saltier than they appeared.
meanings.sent3: The snow on the mountain peak seemed saltier than the rest.
meanings.sent4: His jokes had a saltier taste than usual.
meanings.sent5: The air after the rain had a saltier smell than before.

meanings.sent1: She became saltier when her plans were disrupted.
meanings.sent2: He grew saltier as the meeting went on.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked saltier than usual when the dog stole its toy.
meanings.sent4: His tone became saltier as he argued his point.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's expression turned saltier when the students kept talking.
